lines.content: // For JavaFX, run the Launcher (not MainApp) to avoid launch issues on some setups.
* Entry point and main coordinator for the Cipher task-tracking application.
* Cipher wires together the UI, storage, and task list, then runs a command loop:
* read user input → parse into a command → execute the command → repeat until exit.
* Constructs a Cipher app using the given file path for persistent storage.
* If loading fails, the app starts with an empty task list and shows an error message.
* @param filePath Path to the storage file (e.g. {@code data/cipher.txt})
* Each iteration reads a command from the user, parses it into a {@link Command},
* executes it, and checks whether the app should exit.
* Launches the application using the default data file path.
* Represents an application-specific exception used by Cipher.
* This exception is thrown when user input is invalid or when an operation cannot be completed.
* Constructs a {@code CipherException} with the specified message.
* @param message Error message describing the cause of the exception.
return "Hello! I'm Cipher\nWhat can I do for you?";
// Use a GUI-specific Ui adapter that returns strings instead of printing
// If user typed bye, still allow exit (GUI can close window)
return ui.getOutput() + "\nBye. Hope to see you again soon!";
* A minimal UI adapter for GUI mode.
* Collects messages into a string instead of printing to console.

// Show welcome text in the UI

private final TextArea dialog = new TextArea();
private final TextField input = new TextField();
private final Button send = new Button("Send");

* Represents an executable user command in the Cipher application.
* Concrete subclasses (e.g., {@code TodoCommand}, {@code DeadlineCommand}) implement {@link #execute(TaskList, Ui, Storage)}
* to perform an action and return a {@link CommandResult} that indicates whether the app should exit.
* Executes this command using the given task list, UI, and storage.
* @param tasks   Task list to read from and/or modify
* @param ui      UI used to interact with the user (print messages, etc.)
* @param storage Storage used to load/save tasks
* @return Result containing whether the app should exit after this command
* @throws CipherException If the command cannot be executed due to invalid input or I/O issues
public abstract CommandResult execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws CipherException;
* Returns whether this command causes the application to exit.
* Default is {@code false}. Most commands can simply return {@link CommandResult#cont()} instead.
* @return {@code true} if this command exits the app; otherwise {@code false}
* Represents the outcome of executing a {@link Command}.
* Currently, the only state tracked is whether the application should exit.
* @param isExit Whether the application should exit after executing the command
* Returns whether the application should exit after executing the command.
* @return {@code true} if the app should exit; otherwise {@code false}
* Convenience factory method for an "exit" result.
* @return A {@code CommandResult} indicating the app should exit
* Convenience factory method for a "continue" result.
* @return A {@code CommandResult} indicating the app should continue

* @param ui      UI used to show feedback to the user
* @param storage Storage used to persist the updated task list
* @return A {@link CommandResult} indicating the app should continue
* @throws CipherException If the input format is invalid or saving fails

throw new CipherException("The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
